guide.introduction:
The weather is warming up and it's time for weekend backyard barbecues. You can't have a barbecue without a refreshing drink. This one is great for both adults and kids.

This fun drink was inspired by blackberries being on sale for 88 cents per container. That's a great deal around here! If you can't find fresh berries cheaply, you can use frozen as well. We didn't have any fresh berries left after eating them, so I used frozen here.

Download Recipe PDF

Relevant parts
  • Blackberries
  • Lime zest
  • Lime juice
  • Salt
  • Sugar
  • Sparkling water

lines.text: Combine the blackberries, lime zest, salt, sugar, and lime juice in a small to medium-sized saucepan.
lines.text_raw: Combine the blackberries, lime zest, salt, sugar, and lime juice in a small to medium-sized saucepan.

lines.text: Turn the heat to medium-high and cook just until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat.

lines.text: Place the berry mixture in a blender or food processor and process until smooth.

lines.text: Set a fine mesh strainer over a glass or bowl.

lines.text: Place the puree in the strainer and strain until all that is left are the seeds and the thick pulp.

lines.text: Stirring the mixture in the strainer periodically helps press the juices through faster.

lines.text: In a large pitcher, combine the sparkling water and the blackberry coulis.

lines.text: Be sure to slowly add the coulis to the sparkling water, as it may fizz. Stir until combined.
